H0.text: Whose last opera was 'The Golden Cockerel'. Modest Mussorgsky

H1.text: Whose last opera was 'The Golden Cockerel'. Sergei Prokofiev

H2.text: Whose last opera was 'The Golden Cockerel'. Alexander Borodin

H3.text: Whose last opera was 'The Golden Cockerel'. Rimsy-korsakov

A4.text: The Golden Cockerel (Russian: Золотой петушок, romanized: Zolotoy petushok ) is an opera in three acts, with a short prologue and an even shorter epilogue, composed by Nikolai Rimsky-Korsakov, his last complete opera, before his death in 1908.

A5.text: The opera was completed in 1907, and premiered in 1909, in Moscow, after the composer's death.
